summary: The United States Attorney General is the head of the United States Department of Justice concerned with legal affairs and is the chief law enforcement officer of the United States government.
full_text:
William Francis "Frank" Murphy  was a politician and jurist from Michigan. He was named to the U.S. Supreme Court in 1940 after a political career as Governor of Michigan and Mayor of Detroit, serving also as the last Governor-General of the Philippines and then the High Commissioner of the Philippines.
^ "Federal Judicial Center: Frank Murphy". December 12, 2009. Retrieved December 12, 2009.
title: Frank Murphy
